attributes.action: Temporary cancel controlling parking hours in London
attributes.additional_details:
During limited availability of 
products in stores affects people who move by personal transport in searching of food.Traffic wardens are instantly fining for stopping.
Due to the lack of necessary products in stores motorists go around several grocery stores until they find what they need.
Parking fees for just to enter the store and see an empty shelf and exit immediately are inappropriate.When a credit vacations are granted, it’s absolutely not ethical  to pay a fine for trying to buy salt.
attributes.background: To demand borough Councils temporary suspend controlling parking hours.

rejection.details:
Parking restrictions and charges are a matter for local councils, not the UK Government or Parliament. Since you started this petition, some councils have introduced exemptions for some essential workers. You should check your local council website for more information.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
